name: LTG Exam Prep Platform
overview:
LTG Exam Prep Platform is a tech-education company developing a robust self-learning mobile platform to enable students and others to study for standardized tests. Founded in 2012 by Elad Shoushan, a senior software engineer and current MBA candidate at MIT Sloan, the company is self-financed and revenue generating.

Prep4Gmat’s success with users is based on a new way of studying for standardized tests - “The Label Study Method”, which includes a revolutionary text-processing module that highlights keywords in practice questions to the concepts tested. As the leading study tool using this method, LTG technology is positioned to transform the self-study app space.

Building on its success with Prep4Gmat, LTG has spent the past year focused on developing a generic mobile learning platform, which utilizes the same Label Study Method. The platform includes an external admin system that can be licensed to companies who wish to build a customized version of the study app and provide it as a supplement to their courses. It will save prep companies thousands of dollars on developing a similar app, figuring out the best user experience, and creating proprietary study material with high quality questions and solutions.
